intro: Oncoba poggei, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Oncoba poggei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodlands.
